de.dfki.lt.hfc

Class BindingTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.BindingTable

  • public class BindingTable
extends java.lang.Object
    a wrapper class, hiding a table (a set of int arrays) and several mappings
    Since:
    JDK 1.5

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean addProxyInfo
      in case (addProxyInfo == true), the toString() methods add a further mapping table to the result string, representing the mapping from proxis to URIs
      int[] arguments
      might be assigned a value by Calc.restrict(BindingTable bt, ArrayList predicate); is usually important for tests & actions involving (complex) relational variables
      protected boolean isExpanded
      expansion through expandBindingTable() can only be called once
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> nameToExternalName
      (internal) name (a negative int, e.g., -2) to external name (a string, e.g., "?y")
      protected java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos
      important to establish an order to guarantee proper set operations over binding tables whose column labels vary
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> relIdToFunIds
      might be assigned a value by Calc.restrict(BindingTable bt, ArrayList predicate); is usually important for tests & actions involving (complex) relational variables
      java.util.Set<int[]> table 
      protected TupleStore tupleStore
      needed in case toString() is called in order to access the idToObject field and the proxyToUris field when equivalence class reduction is turned on as specified by Boolean field equivalenceClassReduction in class TupleStore
      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> varToId
      might be assigned a value by Calc.restrict(BindingTable bt, ArrayList predicate); is usually important for tests & actions involving (complex) relational variables

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
        BindingTable()
      assigns the null value to all four public fields
      protected BindingTable(BindingTable bt, TupleStore ts)
      copy constructor for exclusive use in copy constructor of Cluster; only table value needs to be shallow copied
        BindingTable(java.util.Set<int[]> table)
      assigns value of parameter table to this.table; three other fields are assigned the null value
        BindingTable(java.util.Set<int[]> table, java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos)
      assigns non-null values to this.table and this.nameToPos
        BindingTable(java.util.Set<int[]> table, java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> nameToExternalName)
      assigns non-null values to this.table, this.nameToPos, and this.nameToExternalName
        BindingTable(java.util.Set<int[]> table, java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> nameToExternalName, TupleStore tupleStore)
      assigns non-null values to all four public fields
        BindingTable(java.util.Set<int[]> table, java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> nameToExternalName, TupleStore tupleStore, int[] arguments, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> relIdToFunIds, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> varToId)
      a further argument varToId originating from the RuleStore when reading in rules (individual map for each rule)
        BindingTable(java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> nameToExternalName, TupleStore tupleStore)
      assigns non-null values to this.nameToPos, this.nameToExternalName, and this.tupleStore; this.table is assigned an empty THashSet object (all positions are assumed to be relevant)
        BindingTable(TupleStore tupleStore)
      assigns null values to this.nameToPos and this.nameToExternalName; this.tupleStore is set to parameter tupleStore and this.table is assigned an empty THashSet object (all positions are assumed to be relevant)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void expandBindingTable()
      expands this binding table by multiplying out proxies by their equivalent URIs; the method does not check whether equivalence class reduction is turned on or not; in case it is turned off, calling this method does not have an effect
      private void expandTuple(int[] tuple,  proxyToUris, java.util.Set<int[]> newTuples, int pos)
      given a tuple that contains a proxy at position pos, generate copies of this tuple that only differ by replacing the proxy through its equivalences
      java.lang.String toString()
      uses the full URI/XSD name note: in order to properly behave, toString() needs properly set fields, viz., table, nameToPos, nameToExternalName, and tupleStore; note: the content of the table is NOT expanded when this method is called directly
      java.lang.String toString(boolean expand)
      depending on the argument, the content is destructively expanded and returned as a string
      java.lang.String toString(int maxLength)
      maxLength indicates when entries need to be truncated; note: in order to properly behave, toString() needs properly set fields, viz., table, nameToPos, nameToExternalName, and tupleStore; note: the content of the table is NOT expanded when this method is called directly
      java.lang.String toString(int maxLength, boolean expand) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • table

        public java.util.Set<int[]> table

      • nameToPos

        protected java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos
        important to establish an order to guarantee proper set operations over binding tables whose column labels vary

      • nameToExternalName

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> nameToExternalName
        (internal) name (a negative int, e.g., -2) to external name (a string, e.g., "?y")

      • tupleStore

        protected TupleStore tupleStore
        needed in case toString() is called in order to access the idToObject field and the proxyToUris field when equivalence class reduction is turned on as specified by Boolean field equivalenceClassReduction in class TupleStore

      • addProxyInfo

        protected boolean addProxyInfo
        in case (addProxyInfo == true), the toString() methods add a further mapping table to the result string, representing the mapping from proxis to URIs

      • isExpanded

        protected boolean isExpanded
        expansion through expandBindingTable() can only be called once

      • arguments

        public int[] arguments
        might be assigned a value by Calc.restrict(BindingTable bt, ArrayList predicate); is usually important for tests & actions involving (complex) relational variables

      • relIdToFunIds

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> relIdToFunIds
        might be assigned a value by Calc.restrict(BindingTable bt, ArrayList predicate); is usually important for tests & actions involving (complex) relational variables

      • varToId

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> varToId
        might be assigned a value by Calc.restrict(BindingTable bt, ArrayList predicate); is usually important for tests & actions involving (complex) relational variables

    • Constructor Detail

      • BindingTable

        public BindingTable()
        assigns the null value to all four public fields

      • BindingTable

        public BindingTable(java.util.Set<int[]> table)
        assigns value of parameter table to this.table; three other fields are assigned the null value

      • BindingTable

        public BindingTable(TupleStore tupleStore)
        assigns null values to this.nameToPos and this.nameToExternalName; this.tupleStore is set to parameter tupleStore and this.table is assigned an empty THashSet object (all positions are assumed to be relevant)

      • BindingTable

        protected BindingTable(BindingTable bt,
            TupleStore ts)
        copy constructor for exclusive use in copy constructor of Cluster; only table value needs to be shallow copied

            java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos)
        assigns non-null values to this.table and this.nameToPos

            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> relIdToFunIds,
            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> varToId)
        a further argument varToId originating from the RuleStore when reading in rules (individual map for each rule)

      • BindingTable

        public BindingTable(java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> nameToPos,
            java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> nameToExternalName,
            TupleStore tupleStore)
        assigns non-null values to this.nameToPos, this.nameToExternalName, and this.tupleStore; this.table is assigned an empty THashSet object (all positions are assumed to be relevant)

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        uses the full URI/XSD name note: in order to properly behave, toString() needs properly set fields, viz., table, nameToPos, nameToExternalName, and tupleStore; note: the content of the table is NOT expanded when this method is called directly
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean expand)
        depending on the argument, the content is destructively expanded and returned as a string

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int maxLength,
                        boolean expand)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int maxLength)
        maxLength indicates when entries need to be truncated; note: in order to properly behave, toString() needs properly set fields, viz., table, nameToPos, nameToExternalName, and tupleStore; note: the content of the table is NOT expanded when this method is called directly

      • expandBindingTable

        protected void expandBindingTable()
        expands this binding table by multiplying out proxies by their equivalent URIs; the method does not check whether equivalence class reduction is turned on or not; in case it is turned off, calling this method does not have an effect

      • expandTuple

        private void expandTuple(int[] tuple,
                proxyToUris,
               java.util.Set<int[]> newTuples,
               int pos)
        given a tuple that contains a proxy at position pos, generate copies of this tuple that only differ by replacing the proxy through its equivalences
